titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn and Long Island Autograph collection 1977.657
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:39:38 +0000.

did.unittitle: Brooklyn and Long Island Autograph collection
did.abstract: The Brooklyn and Long Island autograph collection spans the period 1800 to 1899 and measures 0.1 linear feet. The collection comprises autographs of many Brooklyn and Long Island residents cut from original documents.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1977.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn and Long Island autograph collection, 1977.657, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
